rComments: He's knowledgeable on the subject but I find the asynchronous lectures are taken far too slowly (would benefit from videos instead of recorded slides). The course notes given instead of a textbook are very bland with no visual representations so I would much rather have something a bit more organized. The class wasn't hard, just memorization
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Gives good feedback', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: (I had him prepandemic) He is very monotone and rambled on random subjects that did not pertain to the class. His exams are very tough. Please read every nook and cranny of that course book and memorize every single type of bacteria, fungus, virus, etc there are. Probably one of the hardest classes Ive taken at uOttawa

Interesting class. Content based on memorization mostly rather than understanding mechanisms. Some of the classifications & info from the course pack + class slides def was different from the recommended textbook of biology of microorganisms, so it ended up being confusing on which classification was correct to study.

I thoroughly enjoyed the content and found it very interesting! The tests can be a bit of a shock at first but once you get used to how questions are worded you won't have that much issues with it! A solid choice for a prof for this class.

Class is difficult, but fair. Professor Yan has clear expectations and provides you with all the content needed to do well. Lectures can be a little slow, and I do recommend listening to the powerpoint recordings at a faster speed. Overall, the class was interesting, just be prepared to study a good amount.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: Posts all his powerpoints online; however they do not have much info on them and you have to read the course note package he uploads. Lecture are boring since he drones and will spend 30 mins talking about hamburgers or something. Midterm was fair but study way ahead of time cause there's lots of content to learn

The class is all about memorization. In 3 hour lectures he always lets you leave at least 30 minutes early. Posts all presentations and gives out a very detailed note package which covers everything that will be on the exams. Can be dry at some times though.

I did not enjoy his class. It was a very difficult class and he made it even harder by it being so dry. He did not seem knowledgeable about many of the topics we learned and droned on about unimportant things forever. His exams were really hard.

Professor Yan is a great prof and I really enjoyed taking this course with him. His lectures are easy to follow but this course is difficult in that it is all memorization- way more than any ANP class, in my opinion. Take your time memorizing the material- his exams are multiple choice AND short answer so watch out for spelling as well.

No textbook, thank God! (I've spent enough on textbooks already!); he posted all his slides/notes on blackboard before the semester even began! :) I was dreading this class, but it was actually really fascinating! There's a TON of material but it's not hard to understand; lots of memorisation. Prof. Yan is a nice guy, exams are very fair.

Interesting and knowledgeable prof! He is super passionate about the topics he teaches and especially C. botulinum!  This is a pure memory course, so if you take the time to memorize the free online text he provides, you will do well.
Great prof definitely a lot of material but clear with expectations and midterms are more than fair if you study adequately. Put in the work and an easy A for sure.

Made a very boring subject surprisingly interesting. Good prof for this course, however if you want a good mark you have to spend a lot of time studying. All the material is presented on his slides and in lectures but requires a lot of memorization.

He was OK. The material was interesting but he just went through everything so slowly I found it hard to concentrate. It definitely didn't help that it was a night class. Lots of memorizing and its easy to get confused between the different pathogens so make sure to practice with cue cards.
Great professor! He was pretty clear on what would be on the midtermsfinal. Listen to what he says in class but don't forget to use the course pack as your guide. Easy A+ if you study
Prof. Yan is da bomb! Take this class with him and you won't be disappointed :)

Dr. Yan is the best prof I have had at UOttawa! He has interesting stories that help with memorizing the MO's for the exams. Its basically pure memory work. The 2 midterms and final are fair. I studied hard for all of them and came out feeling like I overstudied. He is great at answering emails. I loved how there was no textbook just the coursepack

If you can take HSS1100 with this prof, it would be in your BEST interest. First of all, I didn't have to buy a textbook -- he gives you a free course pack on Blackboard with everything you need to know. I printed that at Staples for like, $30. If you read/study it and go to class... easy A.  Super interesting lecturer and responds to emails FAST.
Great and down-to-earth prof. But exams are insanely tough, need to study a week prior to them. Interesting course overall but lots of useless information.
No textbook was needed, but the notes he provided. Nice professor, but sometimes confusing.
Great professor, passionate about his field. Material is easy to grasp if you have a really good memory.
he's very enthusiastic! study the notes and you'll get good grades
Too much information to memorize and his exams are really hard.  He is difficult to understand.  Avoid him if you can.  Needs to use a microphone to be heard.

READ THE COURSE NOTES AND YOU WILL GET AN A+!! Very enthusiastic prof! Makes 3 hour lectures a breeze! Make sure to attend his exam reviews! They are really helpful, he uses stuffed animals and it makes it really memorable and easy to remember which MO belongs to what symptom and such. Wonderful prof!

Great prof. Favourite class this semester. very easy to listen to for 3 hours and makes it interesting. he will add stories to certain kinds of microorganisms so if he says a certain food write it beside the bacteria name! midterm's are fair and can be really easy if you take the time to memorize in advance!

CUTEST ASIAN PROFESSOR EVER. Funny, interesting stories, talks slow enough for you to take notes, midterms are easy if you study. CUTE. Keeps you interested for three hours. LOVE HIMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM. FAVOURITE PROF OF THE SEMESTER.
An excellent professor. If you study you will do well in this class. No tricks.
A fantastic professor. For the midterms and exams, know the course notes he provides and you will do well.

Liked him as a prof - print out his course notes (not slides!) before you go to class and you won't even have to take your own (except to add stuff that isn't directly in them).  Loved that he had guest lecturers in to talk about topics he was less familiar with, their expertise was really interesting to listen to.

Great Prof, easy to listen to for 3 hours. MUST study, or else this class will be hard for you. To get an A+: attend all classes, memorize organisms' names + general characteristics, listen to his stories and take down key notes (ex: if he tells a story about rice, just write RICE next to the bacteria's name, and you'l be able to answer on an exam)
He knows his stuff and teaches it well. I can't stand when professors read directly from the slides, HE DOESN'T. Hooray!

No textbook, but he provides a whole notebook worth of notes from which he teaches off slides, and might relate topics to his own experiences or other national or global health related events. It's as simple as this, as long as you're good at memorizing you'll do well. Otherwise good luck.
Very good professor. The exams are fair as long as you keep up with material. Useful stories and a funny guy. He is also very knowledgeable.

I did not like him. Gives you way too much information that is not even useful. How the laboratory information can be helpful for nurses???? Extremely hard exams. You have to memorize 40-50 pages for exam. In his notes there are mistakes. He uses medical terminology that is not explained. Avoid this prof and your life will be much easier!!!

Very good prof. he has good stories to help you remember info. he explains things very well. the course pack is easy to study from. exams are tough! you really have to know your stuff. but the content is interesting. he always lets you out early. has guest speakers to mix it up. he is very easy to listen to. i can pay attention for the full 3hrs
